questions.question: What is the first step in understanding your financial situation?
questions.explanation: Calculating your net worth (assets minus liabilities) gives you a clear picture of your current financial position.

questions.question: Which account should you prioritize for building an emergency fund?
questions.explanation: High-yield savings accounts offer better interest rates while keeping funds accessible for emergencies.

questions.question: An emergency fund should cover 3-6 months of essential living expenses.
questions.explanation: Most financial experts recommend having 3-6 months of essential expenses saved for unexpected situations.

questions.question: What is the 50/30/20 rule for budgeting?
questions.explanation: The 50/30/20 rule allocates 50% to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings and debt repayment.

questions.question: Which expense tracking method helps you understand spending patterns over time?
questions.explanation: Categorizing expenses helps identify spending patterns and areas for potential savings.

questions.question: You should start investing before building an emergency fund.
questions.explanation: Financial security comes first - build an emergency fund before investing to avoid having to sell investments during emergencies.

questions.question: What should you consider when setting financial goals?
options: SMART criteria (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound)
Goals that match your neighbor's lifestyle
questions.explanation: SMART goals are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound, making them more effective.

questions.question: Which factor is most important when choosing a checking account?
options: The color of the bank logo
Monthly fees and minimum balance requirements
questions.explanation: Monthly fees and minimum balance requirements directly impact your finances - look for accounts with no or low fees.

questions.question: You should review and adjust your budget monthly.
questions.explanation: Regular budget reviews help you stay on track and adjust for life changes or unexpected expenses.

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for managing daily expenses?
options: Track every expense, no matter how small
questions.explanation: Tracking all expenses, even small ones, helps you understand your spending habits and identify areas for improvement.
